Question: Under MCH programme, iron and folic acid tablets to be given daily to mother has
Choices:
  A: 100 mg iron + 500 mcg folic acid
  B: 60 mg iron + 500 mcg folic acid
  C: 60 mg iron + 100 mcg folic acid
  D: 100 mg iron + 100 mcg folic acid
Reflection:
You previously answered this question incorrectly.
Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
Solution:
Under the Maternal and Child Health (MCH) program, pregnant women are given daily iron and folic acid supplements to prevent anemia and neural tube defects in the developing fetus.
The recommended daily dose for pregnant women is 100 mg of elemental iron and 500 mcg of folic acid.
This combination is essential for the proper growth and development of the fetus and the well-being of the mother.

Action: Answer("A")
The recommended daily dose of iron and folic acid supplements for pregnant women under the Maternal and Child Health (MCH) program is 100 mg of elemental iron and 500 mcg of folic acid. This combination is crucial for preventing anemia in the mother and neural tube defects in the developing fetus, ensuring proper growth and development.
